title: Letters: Rachel Dolezal Raises Questions About Racial Identity
teaser: NPR's Melissa Block and Audie Cornish read listener letters about race and identity in light of Rachel Dolezal's resignation as president of the NAACP chapter in Spokane, Wash. Dolezal says she identifies as black, though her parents say she is white.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
